 C8 form for confidentiality of the applicant
Will the applicant, or anyone else attending court, need to speak Welsh or read and write in Welsh during the proceedings?
Do you know if an interpreter will be needed in the court to explain information in a certain language?
Does the applicant, or anyone else attending the court, have a disability?

Describe the adjustments that the court needs to make.

For example - someone with a hearing impairment may need an induction loop to be fitted in the courtroom.

In some cases, the court can make special arrangements for an adult or child involved in the case.

For example - the court may provide a separate waiting room that is set apart from the respondent.
Will the court need to make special arrangements for the applicant, or any child involved in the case?

Give details of the special arrangements that are required.

For example, a screen to separate the applicant from the respondent.

The court can appoint an intermediary for vulnerable applicants.

The intermediary helps the applicant to communicate and give evidence during the case.
Do you know if an intermediary will be required?
Set out the reasons that an intermediary is required.
